00001 #include <interrupts/idt.h>
00002 
00003 struct idt_entry idt[256];
00004 struct idt_ptr idt_ptr;
00005 
00006 extern void idt_flush(uint32 ptr);
00007 static void idt_set_gate(uint8 num, uint32 base, uint16 sel, uint8 flags);
00008 
00009 //This loads the IDT
00010 void Initialize_IDT() 
00011 {
00012         memset(&idt, 0, sizeof(struct idt_entry) * 256);
00013         idt_ptr.limit = sizeof(struct idt_entry) * 256 -1;
00014         idt_ptr.base  = (uint32)&idt;
00015 
00016         outb(0x20, 0x11);
00017         outb(0xA0, 0x11);
00018         outb(0x21, 0x20);
00019         outb(0xA1, 0x28);
00020         outb(0x21, 0x04);
00021         outb(0xA1, 0x02);
00022         outb(0x21, 0x01);
00023         outb(0xA1, 0x01);
00024         outb(0x21, 0x0);
00025         outb(0xA1, 0x0);
00026 
00027         //Set the isr handlers up.
00028 
00029         idt_set_gate( 0, (uint32)isr0 , 0x08, 0x8E);

00083 
00084 static void idt_set_gate(uint8 num, uint32 base, uint16 sel, uint8 flags)
00085 {
00086    idt[num].base_lo = base & 0xFFFF;
00087    idt[num].base_hi = (base >> 16) & 0xFFFF;
00088 
00089    idt[num].sel     = sel;
00090    idt[num].always0 = 0;
00091 
00092    //The 0x60 allows interrupts to be run in user mode
00093    idt[num].flags   = flags | 0x60;
00094 }
